intro: Urtica dioica proles hispida, commonly known as stinging nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its hollow, pointed leaves and fine,螫刺 hairs that cause skin irritation. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and disturbed areas. The plant has a robust rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread vegetatively. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, with separate male and female flowers on different plants. Urtica dioica proles hispida is a member of the Urticaceae family, known for its medicinal and historical uses.
